conclusion: Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, coming into contact with them due to gravity.
When cloth-like objects A and B drop, gravity pulls them straight down onto the blocks beneath them.
Object A is a red sheet, and objects C and D are blocks beneath it.
The red sheet (A) settles on top of blocks C and D, draping over their top faces and stopping when it is supported by those two blocks and the tabletop around them.
Object B is a patterned sheet, and objects E and F are blocks beneath it.
The patterned sheet (B) settles on top of blocks E and F, draping over their top faces and stopping when it is supported by those two blocks and the tabletop around them.
No block is heavy enough to move the others, so all six objects end up resting quietly on the tabletop.
A covers C and D, and B covers E and F.
